Name: Allowing residential condominiums to consolidate required energy efficiency reports.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing residential condominiums to consolidate required energy efficiency reports

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Attachments.Name: July 18, 2018 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - July 18, 2018

Summary: This legislation would allow residential condominiums with multiple covered buildings on different tax block numbers to file required energy efficiency reports into one report.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Exception 2 of section 28-308.4.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 106 for the year 2018, is amended to read as follows:
      2.  [A cooperative corporation that owns multiple] Multiple covered buildings located on different tax block numbers that are held in the condominium or cooperative corporation form of ownership, that is required to file an energy efficiency report for more than one covered building in different calendar years, may consolidate all such energy efficiency reports into one report, disaggregated by covered building, due no later than the year in which the last energy efficiency report would be due, which shall be accepted by the department in satisfaction of the requirements of this section for each covered building included in such consolidated report. 
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect on the same date that local law number 106 for the year 2018 takes effect.
